secondaryItems.name: KC1
secondaryItems.caption: Foot of North Cliffside Path, 1989. By the late 1980s the Cliffside Paths, overgrown and deteriorated, had fallen into ruin. Safety railings were missing and not replaced.
secondaryItems.credit: Photo by Claire Donato, Courtesy of Fairmount Park Archives

secondaryItems.name: KC3
secondaryItems.caption: From 2001 to 2008, the Fairmount Park Conservancy and Women for the Water Works raises funds for the restoration of the Cliffside Paths and South Garden., 2010
secondaryItems.credit: Photo Courtesy of A. Leonard Pundt

historicContext.text: The south garden at the waterworks had been built by 1835, and soon the idea of a large urban recreational park caught the fancy of many citizens, with additional land being acquired for today's Fairmount Park.
